page.title: 17SHOPPING
page.content: There are 7 shops in Geddington. The Post Office attracts the most customers. The Co-op in West Street is large and also used by many residents. There are 3 other shops that sell food in the village:- the Butchers, The Village Pantry and Chapmans. Fresh bread is sold by 3 shops in the village but many residents would like there to be a bakery on site. Fresh bread and vegetables are the items that most people buy in the village but they do their main shopping in Kettering where it is cheaper. Some residents use no village shops at all.
